meanings.definition: A class of organic compounds containing a five-membered ring with four carbon atoms and one oxygen atom.
meanings.sent1: In organic chemistry, tetrahydrofurans play a crucial role as solvents.
meanings.sent2: Researchers often use tetrahydrofurans as solvents due to their unique structure.
meanings.sent3: The tetrahydrofurans in the lab were so friendly, they helped mix the chemicals together.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of ideas, swirling like tetrahydrofurans in a reaction flask.
meanings.sent5: The distinct aroma of tetrahydrofurans lingered in the air of the chemistry lab.

meanings.definition: Tetrahydrofurans are commonly used as solvents in organic chemistry.
meanings.sent1: When conducting experiments, scientists rely on tetrahydrofurans as solvents.
meanings.sent2: The efficient dissolving properties of tetrahydrofurans make them ideal for organic chemistry.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous tetrahydrofurans decided to play hide and seek in the chemical storage room.
meanings.sent4: The progress of the reaction was as smooth as the flow of tetrahydrofurans in a beaker.
meanings.sent5: The transparent nature of tetrahydrofurans allows for easy monitoring of reactions.
